content.description:
Begin standing on the edge of the ledge, find good crimps in the horizontal, and make a committing traverse out over the void to the arete.

Exhilarating and a true threshold route into the world of legit highballs. The climbing is not difficult, but it took me more than a few deep breathes to make that first move! It is a must-do on the mind-control circuit at Riggs....

"This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment.

First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet." --Rumi
content.location: Follow along southern flank until you see glorious high face that climbs over a giant roof. This and the two climbs to the right begin off a high ledge to the right of the big roof.

content.description:
Sit start, make powerful compression slaps and climb featured, arete-like jugs and pockets up the right side of the face. From the sit it may be harder than V0+

Not nearly as good as the other two, this problem is worth doing for sure if you've all the way over here! With a little traffic, it will clean up nicely, though the rock quality is not as good as the other two problems.

This is a little sketchy, since the wall behind you. A good spotter would be nice.
content.location:
It climbs the right side of the face next to

Dark They Were...

.

climbs.name: Dark They Were, and Golden Eyed

content.description:
This climb has beautiful movement as you follow shallow changing corners up terrific rock. Resist the temptation to use holds on the problem to the right, though that could be considered a variation that starts on "Dark They Were.." and finishes on the other problem. Fire straight up the changing corner. The exposed position gives this problem a nice, airy quality.

Not nearly as committing and dangerous as

This Is Love

, popping off the upper lieback of this without a spotter and taking the BIG fall would be unfortunate.
content.location: It is the central problem of three lines climbing off ledge on Southern Flank of Riggs Hill.
